intro: Arouna guianensis, commonly known as the Guianan aruna, is a tropical tree native to the rainforests of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces small, red berries that are an important food source for various wildlife species. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of dense tropical forests. Due to its ecological significance, it plays a vital role in maintaining the biodiversity of its native habitat.
